### [Pi Mounting Screw](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/viewtopic.php?t=182124#p1156302)

[Tue May 02, 2017 10:44 pm](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/viewtopic.php?p=1156302&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86#p1156302)

What type/size screws do you use to mount you Pi in it's case?

* * *

[peterlite](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=187273&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86)**Posts:**[1738](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/search.php?author_id=187273&sr=posts&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86)**Joined:** Sun Apr 17, 2016 4:00 am

### [Re: Pi Mounting Screw](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/viewtopic.php?t=182124#p1156347)

[Wed May 03, 2017 2:40 am](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/viewtopic.php?p=1156347&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86#p1156347)

The Pi has M2.5 holes. The most common size in hobby kits appears to be M3. My Pi now has M3 holes with the help of a 3mm drill bit turned by hand.

* * *

[alphanumeric](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=174101&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86)**Posts:**[3250](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/search.php?author_id=174101&sr=posts&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86)**Joined:** Tue Jan 19, 2016 2:17 pm

### [Re: Pi Mounting Screw](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/viewtopic.php?t=182124#p1156461)

[Wed May 03, 2017 9:34 am](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/viewtopic.php?p=1156461&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86#p1156461)

For the most part I use these, [https://www.adafruit.com/product/2336](https://www.adafruit.com/product/2336) I got lucky, the screws from an old dead laptop I disassembled fit those standoffs perfectly. And the screws are black, double bonus. ![Image 2: :D](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/images/smilies/icon_e_biggrin.gif)

* * *

[peterlite](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=187273&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86)**Posts:**[1738](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/search.php?author_id=187273&sr=posts&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86)**Joined:** Sun Apr 17, 2016 4:00 am

### [Re: Pi Mounting Screw](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/viewtopic.php?t=182124#p1156522)

[Wed May 03, 2017 11:16 am](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/viewtopic.php?p=1156522&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86#p1156522)

I purchased a pack of 300 M3 nylon bits from ebay for about $3 including postage. M2.5 appears to be twice the price or more.

* * *

[alphanumeric](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=174101&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86)**Posts:**[3250](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/search.php?author_id=174101&sr=posts&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86)**Joined:** Tue Jan 19, 2016 2:17 pm

### [Re: Pi Mounting Screw](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/viewtopic.php?t=182124#p1156536)

[Wed May 03, 2017 12:12 pm](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/viewtopic.php?p=1156536&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86#p1156536)

Yeah, 17 bucks US for this pack of nylon bits., [https://www.adafruit.com/product/3299](https://www.adafruit.com/product/3299) Looks to be 400 or so parts.

* * *

[peterlite](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=187273&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86)**Posts:**[1738](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/search.php?author_id=187273&sr=posts&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86)**Joined:** Sun Apr 17, 2016 4:00 am

### [Re: Pi Mounting Screw](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/viewtopic.php?t=182124#p1156813)

[Thu May 04, 2017 2:07 am](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/viewtopic.php?p=1156813&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86#p1156813)

300 M3 AU$6.88 including postage to AU.

[http://www.ebay.com.au/itm/300Pcs-Hex-S ... 1879240962](http://www.ebay.com.au/itm/300Pcs-Hex-Screw-Nut-Spacer-Stand-off-Varied-Length-Assortment-Kit-Set-Box/172574704957?_trksid=p2385738.c100677.m4598&_trkparms=aid%3D222007%26algo%3DSIC.MBE%26ao%3D1%26asc%3D20160908110712%26meid%3Df36c2483abc24b8f8159002d13cda6a0%26pid%3D100677%26rk%3D3%26rkt%3D20%26sd%3D291879240962)

 M2 is the same price and almost as common. M2.5 is rare and expensive by comparison. I already had the 3mm drill bit. Saved me $10 on the standoffs and bolts.

* * *

[Toysrfun](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=279835&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86)**Posts:**[8](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/search.php?author_id=279835&sr=posts&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86)**Joined:** Fri Oct 12, 2018 7:10 am

### [Re: Pi Mounting Screw](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/viewtopic.php?t=182124#p1387132)

[Fri Nov 02, 2018 6:55 am](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/viewtopic.php?p=1387132&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86#p1387132)

For those looking try aliexpress. M3 work great if you run an m3 Tap through than they thread nicely through board otherwise m2.5 like others said. Aliexpress is $2-$3 including shipping for a pack of 100. Keep in mind it’s variety size and you won’t necessarily need all but you can stack the short ones and cater a custom length. In general short length fit lcd screen mounts and longer stack pi boards together. If you want a clean mount you may need a double stack adjustable header unless you plan to use a ribbon cable looped. 10-12mm is common but kit did not have 12 I had to add a pair of washers to each stand-off for correct length in my app using an ssd drive adapter on the bottom end so the usb plug would fit.

> [OldPCGuy](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/memberlist.php?mode=viewprofile&u=216243&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86) wrote: [↑](https://forums.raspberrypi.com/viewtopic.php?p=1156302&sid=d28695c2d5d1d23cfc549574fc81cf86#p1156302)

Description
-----------

[PDF](https://files.printables.com/media/prints/341413/pdfs/341413-raspberry-pi-cam-v2-adjustable-stand-b0102219-3781-4c0e-9cf6-19156cdcd018.pdf)

Needed a new mount for my Raspberry Pi camera, so I found this perfectly-fitting case that worked great:

[https://www.printables.com/model/18211-raspberry-pi-camera-v21-case](https://www.printables.com/model/18211-raspberry-pi-camera-v21-case)

I made a stand that mounts the camera case and is adjustable for height as needed. The design also just happens to manage the ribbon cable!

There's a knob for the setting screw to allows adjustments by hand. Tightening it should be enough to keep the screw in, otherwise a drop of CA glue will work perfectly.

Everything takes four M3 10mm and one M3 nut (preferably locking) to assemble.

Print in any filament you want, just print as oriented in the STL. The 3MF file contains the whole set, along with some layer mods to show the honeycomb infill. This will only work in PrusaSlicer!
